bug.short_desc: E: description-line-too-long for debuginfo package should be removed

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem:
If there is a long package name, automatically generated debuginfo package description is too long, e.g.
$ rpmlint device-mapper-persistent-data-debuginfo-0.0.1-1.fc17.x86_64.rpm
device-mapper-persistent-data-debuginfo.x86_64: E: description-line-too-long C This package provides debug information for package device-mapper-persistent-data.
IMHO there is no way to change it, rpmlint should probably ignore debuginfo package description.
(Don't ask why we need such long name, I have no idea but it is not a bug:-)
Version-Release number of selected component (if applicable): rpmlint-1.4-3.fc17.noarch
How reproducible: just use some long package name and run rpmlint over debuginfo package

Reopening. I'm assuming that this isn't an issue is is a "won't fix" but it should at least be documented.
Ville, is there a way for Fedora to simply ignore the description-line-too-long check for debuginfo packages?

Sure, for example this in config would do it:
addFilter("-debuginfo.* description-line-too-long")
